question: The students are not in favor of the principal’s suggestion to abolish recess. What does abolish mean?
feedback: Make an inference: The students are not in favor...They don't want recess to be canceled.

question: My mom and I saunter through the park on nice days. What does saunter mean?
feedback: Make an inference: on nice days... they're going to enjoy the moment & walk slowly.

question: Her thrifty habits have helped the family to save enough money to buy a house. What does thrifty mean?
feedback: Context Clue: habits...to save enough money. She's economical or careful with money!.

question: The aroma of my mother’s perfume is too sweet for my liking. What does aroma mean?
feedback: Context Clue: of my mother's perfume... signifies a smell or scent.

question: The author kept her story concise so that the readers did not get bored. What does concise mean?
feedback: Make an inference: so that the readers did not get bored... the story was brief or short.

question: The frigid gusts of wind made the tips of their noses hurt. What does frigid mean?
feedback: Make an inference: made the tips of their noses hurt... it's cold!

question: Scratching the mosquito bite will only exacerbate the wound. What does exacerbate mean?
feedback: Make an inference: what happens when you scratch a mosquito bite?...it becomes worst!

question: The 2020 Los Angeles Lakers possess all the attributes to win a Championship. What does attributes mean?
feedback: Context Clue: possess all the...to win a Championship. Qualities to out-score.

question: This test can detect the presence of Covid-19 in your body. What does detect mean?
feedback: Context Clue: test...the presence...in your body. It discovers!

question: The 2016 Golden State Warriors dominated the NBA with a 89% winning record. What does dominate mean?
feedback: Make an inference: 89% winning record... They beat most teams!
